verbose_text: The GFP-Lact labeling was weak and smooth on dendrites without obvious sign of degeneration (XREF_FIG, inset 1), whereas laser injured dendrites of the same neurons exhibited much stronger GFP-Lact labeling (XREF_FIG, inset 2), suggesting that loss of flippases causes low PS exposure preferentially at the distal dendritic arbor, and mechanisms other than P4-ATPase inactivation must exist to boost PS exposure AI.
